channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16562] ITBLL should fail to start if misconfigured
item.description: The number of nodes in ITBLL must a multiple of width*wrap (defaults to 25M, but can be configured by adding two more args to the test invocation) or else verification will fail. This can be very expensive in terms of time or hourly billing for on demand test resources. Check the sanity of test parameters before launching any MR jobs and fail fast if invariants aren't met with an indication what parameter(s) need fixing.
item.summary: ITBLL should fail to start if misconfigured

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: give a patch of "check number nodes"

Please add an extra help message here why the parameter check failed


+

+        long wrap = (long)width*wrapMultiplier;

+        if (wrap < numNodes && numNodes % wrap != 0) {

----> Help message

+          System.err.println(USAGE);

+          return 1;

+        }

and then this is good to go, thanks Heng Chen!
address Andrew Purtell comments, will commit if no other objections
patch v1 for branch-1.2, move the check logic into deeper function maybe called directly by others
addendum move the check logic into deeper function which maybe called directly by others. Test it on standalone mode, it worked.
push patch v1 and addendum to branch-1.3, branch-1, master. push branch-1.2.v1.patch to 0.98, branch-1.0, branch-1.1, branch-1.2

FAILURE: Integrated in Jenkins build HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1 #1271 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1/1271/)
HBASE-16562 ITBLL should fail to start if misconfigured (chenheng: rev 66a82af9f47230b1972a32bea50beb785fb7997a)

  • (edit) hbase-it/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/test/IntegrationTestBigLinkedList.java

Testing 1.2.4RC0 with

hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.test.IntegrationTestBigLinkedList Loop 1 10 \

    100000000 /tmp/itbll 10 -m slowDeterministic

it seems Integer (note - the object, not the primitive) parameters to Generator#run can be null

java.lang.NullPointerException

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.test.IntegrationTestBigLinkedList$Generator.run(IntegrationTestBigLinkedList.java:633)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.test.IntegrationTestBigLinkedList$Loop.runGenerator(IntegrationTestBigLinkedList.java:1260)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.test.IntegrationTestBigLinkedList$Loop.run(IntegrationTestBigLinkedList.java:1310)

        at org.apache.hadoop.util.ToolRunner.run(ToolRunner.java:70)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.test.IntegrationTestBigLinkedList.runTestFromCommandLine(IntegrationTestBigLinkedList.java:1662)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.IntegrationTestBase.doWork(IntegrationTestBase.java:123)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.AbstractHBaseTool.run(AbstractHBaseTool.java:106)

        at org.apache.hadoop.util.ToolRunner.run(ToolRunner.java:70)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.test.IntegrationTestBigLinkedList.main(IntegrationTestBigLinkedList.java:1702)
Andrew Purtell the patch for this jira has been committed and never reverted, so jira isn't in sync with git at the moment. Shall we close this jira and open new one?
going through the discrepancies preparing first 1.3 RC

This patch should be reverted. I had hoped my reopening of the issue would have triggered discussion leading to an addendum but that has not materialized. So let's revert. Can use a new issue for that, sure. Mikhail Antonov
I've reverted this from branch-1.2 in preparation for another RC. Happy to have it back when the above issue is addressed.

Then for sake of consistency could you revert everywhere Sean Busbey ?
/cc Mikhail Antonov
sure thing. will post when done.

I don't see a rel/0.98.23 tag, but I believe this change was included in the 0.98.23RC0 that passed a vote. Do you still want a simple revert there? Or would you prefer I leave the 0.98 fix version here and make a follow-on that backs out the changes for the next 0.98 release?

same deal in branch-1.1. This change is in the 1.1.7 release.

/cc Nick Dimiduk

Thanks for the reminder. I'll push that tag soon.
Yes a follow up JIRA for the revert would make reporting the change easy, via release notes
Also in 1.1.7 IIRC

okay, reverted from branches that hadn't had a release simply. reverted from 0.98 and branch-1.1 using the linked follow on jira.

If anyone wants to fix this, please start with a new JIRA.
